intro: Vandenboschia naseana, commonly known as the Cape snowbush, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and adaptations to arid environments. The plant features a low-growing, mat-forming structure with pale blue to white flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are cylindrical and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Vandenboschia naseana is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
